summary:
A suicide bomber struck a Shiite mosque on the outskirts of Islamabad during Friday prayers, killing 31 worshippers and wounding 169. The attack, rare for Pakistan's capital, underscores a militant surge challenging government control. Officials are probing ties to militant groups and have increased security nationwide, affecting millions of residents. Further investigations and potential group claims are expected.

In Oman, Iran and the United States conducted indirect talks on Tehran's nuclear program, the first amid post-strike tensions and President-elect Trump threats. Iran's foreign minister called it a good start, with follow-up meetings planned; the discussions impact global nonproliferation efforts. In Gaza, Israel allowed thousands of displaced Palestinians to enter northern areas after breaking a hostage release deadlock, affecting 2 million enclave residents and facilitating aid and rebuilding amid the conflict. Separately, the US Congress approved a $50 billion foreign aid bill for democracy programs, scholarships, embassies, and health initiatives worldwide, overriding Trump administration reduction plans; funds will deploy immediately to global partners.

A gunman shot Russian Lt. Gen. Vladimir Alekseyev, an intelligence officer sanctioned twice by the US for Ukraine invasion support, in Moscow; the investigation proceeds amid attacks on senior officers. Ukraine disabled Russian access to Starlink terminals and bolstered drone defenses after strikes on energy infrastructure and logistics, hindering Moscow's operations. NATO deployed its first coordinated response following a second Baltic Sea cable severance. The US accused China of secret nuclear tests after New START expiration. US authorities arrested Zubayr al-Bakoush for his role in the 2012 Benghazi attack killing Ambassador Stevens and three others; he faces US prosecution. NASA and SpaceX launched Crew-10 with four astronauts from Florida to the International Space Station, enabling the return of Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams after nine months.

headlines.title: Suicide bomber kills 31 worshippers at Shiite mosque on Islamabad outskirts
headlines.summary: Suicide bomber strikes Shiite mosque during Friday prayers on Islamabad outskirts, killing 31 and wounding 169 in rare capital attack. Militant surge challenges Pakistan government control. Officials probe group ties; heightens security nationwide affecting millions.

headlines.title: US authorities arrest Zubayr al-Bakoush for role in 2012 Benghazi attack killing four Americans
headlines.summary: Attorney General Pam Bondi announces custody of Zubayr al-Bakoush, key participant in 2012 Benghazi compound attack that killed Ambassador Stevens and three others. He faces prosecution in US. Brings partial justice after 14 years, impacts counterterrorism efforts.

headlines.title: Oman mediates indirect nuclear talks between Iran and United States
headlines.summary: Iran and US hold first indirect talks on Tehran's nuclear program in Oman amid post-strike tensions and Trump threats. Iran's minister calls it good start. Affects global nonproliferation; parties plan follow-up meetings.

headlines.title: Israel allows displaced Palestinians to cross into northern Gaza
headlines.summary: Israel permits thousands of displaced Gazans to walk back to northern Gaza after breaking hostage release deadlock. Affects 2 million residents in enclave. Signals potential de-escalation; enables aid and rebuilding amid ongoing conflict.

headlines.title: Gunman shoots Russian Lt. Gen. Vladimir Alekseyev in Moscow
headlines.summary: Assailant shoots Lt. Gen. Vladimir Alekseyev, Ukraine invasion intelligence provider, in latest Moscow attack on top officers. US sanctioned him twice. Investigation ongoing; escalates internal threats amid war, affects Russian military leadership.

headlines.title: NASA and SpaceX launch four astronauts to retrieve two stuck on space station
headlines.summary: SpaceX Crew-10 with NASA, JAXA, Roscosmos astronauts launches from Florida to International Space Station, enabling return of Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams after nine months. Routine rotation ensures continuous operations; boosts US space partnerships.

headlines.title: Congress passes 50 billion dollar foreign aid bill despite Trump 2025 cuts
headlines.summary: US Congress approves $50 billion for democracy, scholarships, embassies, health programs worldwide, overriding Trump administration reductions. Affects global partners and US interests. Funds deploy immediately; counters isolationism in foreign policy.

headlines.title: Ukraine disables Russian Starlink access and strengthens drone defenses
headlines.summary: Ukraine cuts Russian use of Starlink and bolsters drone defenses amid strikes on energy sites and logistics. Impacts Russian operations far from front lines. Enhances Kyiv resilience; prolongs conflict dynamics for Europe.

headlines.title: NATO deploys first coordinated response after another Baltic Sea cable severance
headlines.previousContext: Alliance activates response following severance of second deep-sea cable amid suspected sabotage campaign

headlines.title: US accuses China of secret nuclear tests after New START expiration
headlines.previousContext: US levels accusations and pushes for new arms deal including China post-US-Russia treaty lapse

headlines.title: Israel permits Gazans to enter northern zone after prior strikes
headlines.previousContext: Israel opens military zone for returns following hostage deal breakthrough after deadly strikes
